In order to promote the use of the Ubuntu Software Center among users, and to promote upstream applications among Ubuntu users, we are beginning a campaign to get "Download for Ubuntu" buttons on the Download pages of upstream websites.

{{http://developer.ubuntu.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/downloadonubuntubutton.png}}

Below is a list of the top 100 applications in the Software Center.  Pick one and contact the upstream developers with the provided HTML snippet.  Explain what it will do, and that it will help make their application easier to install for Ubuntu users.  Be sure to put your name in the last column so that others know you are working on it, and remove the row once you know the button has been added.

=== FAQ ===

{*} '''Q:''' '''Why link to https://apps.ubuntu.com/cat/<myapp> when we could directly link to apt://<myapp>?'''

{*} '''A:''' We recommend to link to apps.ubuntu.com mainly because non-Ubuntu users won't be able to load an apt URL. It also means that we can show people the ratings and reviews and other potential features for non-Ubuntu users.

{*} '''Q:''' '''Will this image change in the (close) future? '''(for example: new design; dynamic image for i10n; etc...) Because at the moment it links to a (non dynamic) image from an upload wordpress folder, and future changes will mean, with the current link, must contact again every project site.
